<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/1894> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/caturi> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/article>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/1894> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromDpt> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/TSI>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/1894> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromGroup> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/TSAC>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/1894> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Belfiore_Jean-claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/1894> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Diagonal Algebraic Space-Time Block Codes"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/1894> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014 We construct a new family of linear space-time block codes by the combination of rotated constellations and the Hadamard transform, and we prove them to achieve the full transmit diversity over a quasi-static or fast fading channels. The proposed codes transmit at a normalized rate of 1 symbol/sec. When the number of transmit antennae n = 1, 2 or n is a multiple of 4 we spread a rotated version of the information symbol vector by the Hadamard transform and send it over n transmit antennae and n time periods; for other values of n, we construct the codes by sending the components of a rotated version of the information symbol vector over the diagonal of an n \u00D7 n space-time code matrix. The codes maintain their rate, diversity and coding gains for all real and complex constellations carved from the complex integers ring Z[i], and they outperform the codes from orthogonal design when using complex constellations for n > 2. The maximum likelihood decoding of the proposed codes can be implemented by the sphere decoder at a moderate complexity. It is shown that using the proposed codes in a multi-antenna system yields good performances with high spectral efficiency and moderate decoding complexity."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2105> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4581> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Belfiore_Jean-claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4581> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "A Construction of a Space-Time code based on the Theory of Numbers"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4581> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014We construct a full data rate space\u2013time (ST) block code over =2transmit antennas and =2symbol periods, and we prove that it achieves a transmit diversity of 2 over all constellations carved from [ ]. Further, we optimize the coding gain of the proposed code and then compare it to the Alamouti code. It is shown that the new code outper-forms the Alamouti code at low and high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) when the number of receive antennas 1. The performance improvement is further enhanced when or the size of the constellation increases. We relate the problem of ST diversity gain to algebraic number theory, and the coding gain optimization to the theory of simultaneous Diophantine approximation in the geometry of numbers. We find that the coding gain optimization is equivalent to finding irrational numbers \" the furthest \" from any simultaneous rational approximations."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4588> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4588> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/caturi> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/article>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4588> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromDpt> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/COMELEC>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4588> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromGroup> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/COMNUM>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4588> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Belfiore_Jean-claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4588> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Diagonal Algebraic Space Time Block Codes"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4588> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014 We construct a new family of linear space-time block codes by the combination of rotated constellations and the Hadamard transform, and we prove them to achieve the full transmit diversity over a quasi-static or fast fading channels. The proposed codes transmit at a normalized rate of 1 symbol/sec. When the number of transmit antennae n = 1, 2 or n is a multiple of 4 we spread a rotated version of the information symbol vector by the Hadamard transform and send it over n transmit antennae and n time periods; for other values of n, we construct the codes by sending the components of a rotated version of the information symbol vector over the diagonal of an n \u00D7 n space-time code matrix. The codes maintain their rate, diversity and coding gains for all real and complex constellations carved from the complex integers ring Z[i], and they outperform the codes from orthogonal design when using complex constellations for n > 2. The maximum likelihood decoding of the proposed codes can be implemented by the sphere decoder at a moderate complexity. It is shown that using the proposed codes in a multi-antenna system yields good performances with high spectral efficiency and moderate decoding complexity."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5337> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014A family of space-time codes suited for non coherent multi-input multi-output (MIMO) systems is presented. These codes use all the complex degrees of freedom of the system, i.e. (1 ()) symbols per channel use [1]. They are constructed as codes on the Grassmann manifold () where is the temporal codelength and is the number of transmit antennas. Index Terms\u2014Degrees of freedom, GLRT detector, sphere packing in Grassmannians."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2333> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Estimation r\u00E9cursive pour les mod\u00E8les autor\u00E9gressifs localement stationnaires"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2333> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "2 Remerciements Mes premiers remerciements s'adressent\u00E0adressent\u00E0 Sergue\u00A8\u0131Sergue\u00A8\u0131 Pergamenchtchikov. Ce fut pour moi un r\u00E9el plaisir de travailler sous sa direction tout au long de ces quatre ann\u00E9es durant lesquelles j'ai e\u00F9 a appr\u00E9cier sa culture math\u00E9matique, ses grandes comp\u00E9tences, sa dispo-nibilit\u00E9 et son efficacit\u00E9. Je dois\u00E9galementdois\u00E9galement saluer ses qualit\u00E9s p\u00E9dagogiques, son optimisme (r\u00E9aliste) qui, dans les p\u00E9riodes de doute, m'a permis de reprendre confiance et pouss\u00E9 pouss\u00E9\u00E0 ne pas baisser les bras. Pour toutes ces raisons, je ne peux que me f\u00E9liciter de l'avoir choisi pour m'encadrer. Je tiens\u00E0tiens\u00E0 remercier ensuite Leonid Galtchouk et Delphine Blanke d'avoir accept\u00E9 la t\u00E2che de rapporter ma th\u00E8se. Les travaux de Galtchouk et Pergamenchtchikov ont initi\u00E9 chacune des deux parties de ma th\u00E8se, c'est donc pour moi un honneur qu'ils aient bien voulu en\u00E9valueren\u00E9valuer le contenu. Je suis par ailleurs d'autant plus honor\u00E9e que Dominique Fourdrinier ait accept\u00E9 de pr\u00E9sider le jury. J'en viens maintenant\u00E0maintenant\u00E0 ceux qui m'ont donn\u00E9 go\u00FBt aux math\u00E9matiques et qui m'ont donn\u00E9 l'envie de poursuivre dans cette voie. Il est sans doute difficile de savoir\u00E0savoir\u00E0 quel moment cela s'est produit, mais j'estime, sans nul doute, que je le dois en premier\u00E0premier\u00E0 Hamid Louni, mon enseignant de Statistiques durant ma licence, qui par ses talents de p\u00E9dagogue, sa rigueur (ses blagues de matheux aussi), a suscit\u00E9 une vocation enfouie en moi et m'a soutenue dans ce que j'ai entrepris. Je ne le remercierai jamais assez. Je pense ensuit\u00E8 a Fazia Bedouhene, mon enseignante deprem\u00EC ere ann\u00E9e universitaire, qui s'investissait remarquablement dans l'enseignement, qui a toujours\u00E9t\u00E9toujours\u00E9t\u00E9 pr\u00E9sente et fait preuve de patience pour les nombreuses questions que j'ai pu lui poser. Je tiens\u00E0tiens\u00E0 lui exprimer ma profonde gratitude. Dans cet ordre d'id\u00E9es, j'exprime mes remerciements aux membres du d\u00E9partement de math\u00E9matiques de l'Universit\u00E9 de Rouen, en particulier Paul Raynaud de Fitte, Fran\u00E7ois Charlot, Thierry de La Rue, \u00B4 Elise Janvresse, L\u00E9o Glangetas et qu\u00EC a un moment ou un autre ont tous plus ou moins contribu\u00E9contribu\u00E9\u00E0 mon\u00E9panouissementmon\u00E9panouissement dans le domaine des math\u00E9matiques. 3 4 Merc\u00ED egalement\u00E0egalement\u00E0 Edwige Auvray et Marguerite Losada pour leur pr\u00E9sence, leur ef-ficacit\u00E9 et leur patience. Je veux\u00E9galementveux\u00E9galement remercier Claude Dellacherie, Thierry de La Rue et\u00C9liseet\u00B4et\u00C9lise Janvresse pour l'organisation de l'atelier des doctorants. J'y ai beaucoup appris autant sur le plan math\u00E9matique, sur la fa\u00E7on de communiquer que sur le plan culinaire. Je lui dois de pr\u00E9cieuses corrections. Il m'estparticul\u00EC erement agr\u00E9able de d\u00E9dier cette th\u00E8se de doctorat\u00E0doctorat\u00E0 mon oncle le penseur et historien Mohammed Arkoun dont le parcours intellectuel a, depuis mon jeun\u00EAjeun\u00EA age, constitu\u00E9 pour moi un exemple et une r\u00E9f\u00E9rence. Je ne le remercierai jamais assez pour avoir guid\u00E9 mes premiers pas en France, pour les pr\u00E9cieux conseils qu'il n'a cess\u00E9 de me prodiguer, son ind\u00E9fectible soutien moral et son assistance mat\u00E9rielle. Qu'il trouve ici le profond t\u00E9moignage de ma reconnaissance et de mon affection. Je d\u00E9di\u00E9 egalement ce travail de th\u00E8s\u00E8 a mes parents que je remercie pour l'enseigne-ment qu'ils m'ont transmis et pour leur irrempla\u00E7able et inconditionnel soutien. Ils ont\u00E9t\u00E9ont\u00E9t\u00E9 pr\u00E9sents pour\u00E9carterpour\u00E9carter les doutes, soigner les blessures et partager les joies. Sans eux, je ne serais pas l` a o` u je suis aujourd'hui. Je remercie toutparticul\u00EC erement ma m` ere Ghenima pour avoir\u00E9t\u00E9avoir\u00E9t\u00E9 toujours\u00E0toujours\u00E0 mes c\u00F4t\u00E9s tout au long de mes\u00E9tudesmes\u00E9tudes et qui a toujours cru en ma volont\u00E9 de r\u00E9ussir. A mes beaux-parents, pour leur amour et la disponibilit\u00E9 dont ils ont constamment fait preuv\u00E8 a mon\u00E9gardmon\u00E9gard, A ma grand-m` ere, d\u00E9c\u00E9d\u00E9e il y a peu et qui serait contente d'apprendre que sa petite fille a termin\u00E9 le travail quelle avait commenc\u00E9, A Islam, mon\u00E9pouxmon\u00E9poux, je dis \" ce travail te doit beaucoup...qu'il soit pour toi le t\u00E9moignage de mon infinie reconnaissance pour ces ann\u00E9es de compr\u00E9hension, de privations et d'efforts communs \" , A mon tr\u00E8s cher fils Rayan, con\u00E7u et n\u00E9 pendant la r\u00E9alisation de cette th\u00E8se, A mes trois fr\u00E8res Youcef, Brahim et Mohammed ainsi qu'` a ma soeur Dahbia, son mari Nacer et leurs enfants Samih et Manel. 5 Toute mon amiti\u00E9amiti\u00E9\u00E0 Ali Righi avec qui j'ai partag\u00E9 le bureau pendant ces ann\u00E9es, avec qui j'ai eu beaucoup de plaisir\u00E0plaisir\u00E0 apprendre la programmation en Scilab et avec qui j'ai eu tant de discussions fructueuses. Je ne saurais clore ces remerciements sans une pens\u00E9eparticul\u00EC er\u00E8 a mon amie As-sia Ghezali pour les trois ann\u00E9es pass\u00E9es ensembl\u00E8 a Oued-Aissi dans le rire et la bonne humeur et sans saluer ici tous ceux qui ont partag\u00E9 ou partagent encore mon bureau : Abdelatif et Nicolas. Je passe ensuite une d\u00E9dicace sp\u00E9cial\u00E8 a tous les doctorants que j'ai eu le plaisir de c\u00F4toyer durant ces quelques ann\u00E9esann\u00E9es\u00E0 Rouen, avec qui j'ai pass\u00E9 de bons moments au RU, en salle de convivialit\u00E9 ou au soleil sur la terrasse, ` a savoir Aicha, Houda, Islam, Karima, les deux Olivier, Lahcen, Lamia, Manel, Vincent. Enfin merc\u00EC a toutes les personnes que je n'ai pas cit\u00E9es ici et qui j'esp\u00E8re se re-conna\u02C6\u0131trontconna\u02C6\u0131tront dans ces quelques lignes. 6 R\u00E9sum\u00E9 Cette th\u00E8se se consacr\u00E8 a l'estimation non param\u00E9trique pour les mod\u00E8les autor\u00E9gressifs. Nous consid\u00E9rons leprob\u00EC eme de l'estimation d'une fonction inconnue en un point fix\u00E8 a l'aide de donn\u00E9es r\u00E9gies par des mod\u00E8les autor\u00E9gressifs. Pour d\u00E9finir le risque associ\u00E9associ\u00E9\u00E0 l'emploi d'un estimateur et ainsi mesurer la qualit\u00E9 de celui-ci, nous utilisons la fonction de perte li\u00E9\u00E8 a l'erreur absolue. Le travail de cette th\u00E8se suit l'approche minimax dont l'objectif est de trouver une borne inf\u00E9rieure asymptotique du risque minimax puis de construire un estimateur, dit asymptotiquement efficace, dont le risque maximal atteint asymptotiquement cette borne. Pour un mod\u00E8le autor\u00E9gressif non param\u00E9trique o` u la fonction autor\u00E9gressive est sup-pos\u00E9e appartenir\u00E0appartenir\u00E0 une classe H\u00F6ld\u00E9rienne faible de r\u00E9gularit\u00E9 connue, nous montrons qu'un estimateur\u00E0estimateur\u00E0 noyau est asymptotiquement efficace. Lorsque la r\u00E9gularit\u00E9 de la fonction au-tor\u00E9gressive est inconnue, nous obtenons la vitesse de convergence minimax adaptative des estimateurs sur une famille de classes H\u00F6ld\u00E9riennes. Abstract This thesis is devoted to nonparametric estimation for autoregressive models. We consider the problem of estimating an unknown function at a fixed point using data governed by autoregressive models. To define the risk associated with the use of an estimator and thus measure the quality of it, we use the loss function related to the absolute error. The work of this thesis follows the minimax approach for which the goal is to find a lower bound of the asymptotic minimax risk and then to construct an estimator, said asymptotically efficient, for which the maximum risk reaches asymptotically this bound. For a nonparametric autoregressive model where the autoregressive function is supposed to belong to a weak H\u00F6lder class with known regularity, we show that a kernel estimator is asymptotically efficient. When the regularity of the autoregressive function is unknown, we get the minimax adaptive convergence rate of estimators on a family of H\u00F6lderian classes."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5619> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "A Conceptual semantics for prepositions denoting instrumentality"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5619> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper, we present a semantic analysis and a representation for prepositions denoting instrumentality. The abstract parameters defining instrumentality are elaborated and a model of the interactions agent-object-instrument is proposed and implemented using the Lexical Conceptual Structure. 1 An analysis of the primitive notion of instrumentality and its lexicalisations The notion of instrument seems to appear at a very early stage of the the semantico-cognitive development of children and has often been considered as a primitive notion (Wierzbicka, 1992). Moreover, at first glance, its content can be expressed by a very intuitive paraphrase: an instrument is an object used to obtain or to reach a certain goal. However, in spite of this apparent simplicity, the parameters defining this notion from a semantic and lexical point of view are extremely complex and subtle. Our study is both analytical and formal; it considers the abstract notions as well as the possible lexicalisations. This work concentrates on four representative prepositions of the notion of instrumentality in French-par (~by), gr\u00E2ce \u00E0 (~thanks to), au moyen de (~by means of), avec (~with)-and is organised in two parts. The first part attempts to identify the abstract parameters that define the notion of instrumentality, the constraints on its lexicalisations and on its contextual values. In the second part, we suggest a model using the Lexical Conceptual Structure (LCS) (Jackendoff, 1990) and elements of the Generative Lexicon (GL) (Pustejovsky, 1995) that we settle within a compositional framework. Our general aim is to provide under-specified representations for the abstract notion, and LCS for its representation and contextual values (usage examples). A \u03BB-calculus for computing meanings is also provided. 2 Analysing the notion of instrumentality via its lexicalisations 2.1 Three levels of analysis: notions, senses and values In the semantic literature, there exist two ways to capture the notion of instrumentality: the first one considers the object type expected by the preposition complement (Poncet-Montagne, 1991); the second one consists in identifying the possible relations between the sub-event denoted by the VP and the \" causing \" sub-event, i.e. the one involving both the subject and the preposition complement: for Jean mange avec une cuilli\u00E8re (John eats with a spoon) the causing sub-event is \" Jean uses a spoon \". Talmy's famous work on force relations (Talmy, 1976) relies on this second option. Nevertheless, considering only the cognitive universal aspect of this notion, his work ignores the constraints on the structure of these sub-events, the specificities related to their possible lexicalisations and the parameters defining the control relations among the entities involved within these sub-events. Our analysis based on event structure considers all of these parameters. Moreover, our contribution extends toward the interpretation of"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5892> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5892> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromDpt> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/INFRES>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2305> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Nicolas_Jean-Marie>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2305> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Accuracy of Fisher Distributions and Log-moment Estimation to describe Amplitude Distributions of High Resolution SAR Images over Urban Areas"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2305> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014 The framework of this study is classification of high resolution SAR images over urban areas. Statistics of these images reflect the presence of strong reflectors scattered all over; therefore histograms have a heavy tail. We propose a new distribution model (Fisher distribution) to fit such probability density functions. As its moments are not defined for all parameter values, we use a second kind statistics based estimation (log-moment estimation). The purpose of this article is the validation of both estimation method and distribution model. We first prove that, in this context, log-moment method is more accurate than moment method. We also demonstrate that Fisher functions are the most accurate for man-made structures. Finally these distributions are used in a Markovian classification."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2306> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/3617> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Saint-Dizier_P_>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/3617> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "A conceptual semantics for prepositions denoting instrumentality"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/3617> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper, we present a semantic analysis and a representation for prepositions denoting instrumentality. The abstract parameters defining instrumentality are elaborated and a model of the interactions agent-object-instrument is proposed and implemented using the Lexical Conceptual Structure. 1 An analysis of the primitive notion of instrumentality and its lexicalisations The notion of instrument seems to appear at a very early stage of the the semantico-cognitive development of children and has often been considered as a primitive notion (Wierzbicka, 1992). Moreover, at first glance, its content can be expressed by a very intuitive paraphrase: an instrument is an object used to obtain or to reach a certain goal. However, in spite of this apparent simplicity, the parameters defining this notion from a semantic and lexical point of view are extremely complex and subtle. Our study is both analytical and formal; it considers the abstract notions as well as the possible lexicalisations. This work concentrates on four representative prepositions of the notion of instrumentality in French-par (~by), gr\u00E2ce \u00E0 (~thanks to), au moyen de (~by means of), avec (~with)-and is organised in two parts. The first part attempts to identify the abstract parameters that define the notion of instrumentality, the constraints on its lexicalisations and on its contextual values. In the second part, we suggest a model using the Lexical Conceptual Structure (LCS) (Jackendoff, 1990) and elements of the Generative Lexicon (GL) (Pustejovsky, 1995) that we settle within a compositional framework. Our general aim is to provide under-specified representations for the abstract notion, and LCS for its representation and contextual values (usage examples). A \u03BB-calculus for computing meanings is also provided. 2 Analysing the notion of instrumentality via its lexicalisations 2.1 Three levels of analysis: notions, senses and values In the semantic literature, there exist two ways to capture the notion of instrumentality: the first one considers the object type expected by the preposition complement (Poncet-Montagne, 1991); the second one consists in identifying the possible relations between the sub-event denoted by the VP and the \" causing \" sub-event, i.e. the one involving both the subject and the preposition complement: for Jean mange avec une cuilli\u00E8re (John eats with a spoon) the causing sub-event is \" Jean uses a spoon \". Talmy's famous work on force relations (Talmy, 1976) relies on this second option. Nevertheless, considering only the cognitive universal aspect of this notion, his work ignores the constraints on the structure of these sub-events, the specificities related to their possible lexicalisations and the parameters defining the control relations among the entities involved within these sub-events. Our analysis based on event structure considers all of these parameters. Moreover, our contribution extends toward the interpretation of"

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2370> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Independent Component Analysis of Largely Underdetermined Mixtures"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2370> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper we derive algebraic means for Independent Component Analysis (ICA) with more sources than sensors. The results are based on the structure of the fourth-order cu-mulant tensor. We derive bounds on the number of sources that generically guarantee uniqueness of the decomposition. The mixing matrix is computed by means of simultaneous diagonalization or off-diagonalization techniques."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/3972> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Representing 2D Cartoons using SVG"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/3972> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Our work focuses on the encoding of 2D graphics animated cartoons with SVG. We expected this could be an efficient and useful coding with good versatility for various types of terminals. First, we present some technical specification for such cartoons. Next, we give an overview of SVG support for cartoons and present methods best suited for a such task; some of our proposals could be useful for other 2D graphics application than animated cartoon. We also give some considerations on the compression and streaming of such cartoons."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4848> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "OPTIMIZED PREDICTION OF UNCOVERED AREAS IN SUBBAND VIDEO CODING"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4848> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Motion-compensated temporal filtering is an essential ingredient of recently developed wavelet-based scalable video coding schemes. Lifting implementation of these decompo-sitions represents a versatile tool for spatio-temporal optimizations and numerous improvements have thus been proposed. In this paper, we propose an optimized prediction scheme built on a 5/3 motion-compensated filterbank but using motion vector fields in the same direction. Optimization is done by estimating one of the motion vector field such that to minimize the detail subband energy, knowing that some parts of a current image have already been predicted by the other motion vector field. Experimental results show that significant improvements in compression performance can be achieved using this strategy, for equivalent complexity ."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2137> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Asymptotic analysis of optimum and sub-optimum CDMA downlink MMSE receivers"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/2137> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper, we investigate the performance of two linear receivers for CDMA downlink transmissions over frequency selective channels, the users having possibly different powers. The optimum Minimum Mean Square Error (MMSE) receiver is first considered. Because this receiver requires the knowledge of the code vectors attributed to all the users within the cell when these vectors are time varying, its use may be unrealistic in the forward link. A classical sub-optimum receiver, consisting in a chip rate equalizer followed by a despreading with the code of the user of interest, is therefore studied and compared to the optimum MMSE receiver. Performance of both receivers is assessed through the Signal to Interference plus Noise Ratio (SINR) at their outputs. The analytical expressions of these SINRs depend in a rather non explicit way on the codes allocated to the users of the cell, and are therefore not informative. This difficulty is dealt with by modeling the users code matrix by a random matrix. Because the code matrices used in the forward link are usually isometric, the code matrix is assumed to be extracted from a Haar distributed random unitary matrix. The behavior of the SINRs is studied when the spreading factor and the number of users converge to \u221E at the same rate. Using certain results of the free probability theory, we establish the fact that the SINRs converge almost surely toward quantities that depend only on the (1)Tha\u00EC es Communications, 66, rue du Foss\u00E9-Blanc, 92231 Gennevilliers, France \u2013 Universit\u00E9 de Marne-La-Vall\u00E9e. Phone: +33 1 60 95 72 89, Fax: +33 1 60 95 72 14, chaufray@univ-mlv.fr. (2) Corresponding author \u2013 Sup\u00E9lec, Plateau de Moulon,. Phone: +33 1 60 95 72 93, Fax: +33 1 60 95 72 14, loubaton@univ-mlv.fr. Permission to publish this abstract separately is granted June 28, 2004 SUBMITTED VERSION IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON INFORMATION THEORY 2 complex amplitudes of propagation channel paths. We then put into profit the expressions of these SINR limits to discuss the influence of the various parameters on the performance of the receivers."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4908> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4908> <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/Place> "Texas, USA"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4908> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/caturi> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/inproceedings>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4908> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Belfiore_Jean-claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4908> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Joint Source-Channel Coding of Scalable Video"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4908> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "A joint source-channel coding scheme for scalable video is developed in this paper. An SNR scalable video coder is used and Unequal Error Protection (UEP) is allowed for each scalable layer. Our problem is to allocate the available bit rate across scalable layers and, within each layer, between source and channel coding , while minimizing the end-to-end distortion of the received video sequence. The resulting optimization algorithm we propose utilizes universal rate-distortion characteristic plots. These plots show the contribution of each layer to the total distortion as a function of the source rate of the layer and the residual bit error rate (the error rate that remains after the use of channel coding). Models for these plots are proposed in order to reduce the computational complexity of the solution. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5339> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Near maximum likelihood detection using an interior point method and semidefinite programming"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5339> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper a maximum likelihood detection problem for a digital communication system is reformulated as a semidefinite programming (SDP) problem. A relaxation of this problem is done. An interior point method will be used to efficiently solve the semidefinite program arising from the relaxation. From the solution given by this interior point method, an approximate of the solution of the initial ML detection problem will be extracted using a randomization method. The detection method presented in this paper will have near ML performances with a polynomial complexity."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5085> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In the context of MIMO maximum-likelihood detection, efficient iterative algorithms are proposed to solve the semi-definite programming relaxation based on a reduced rank non linear formulation. The convergence of the algorithms is studied theoretically and experimentally. The influence of various parameters on the performance is also analysed. The overall complexity is evaluated and some implementation issues are pointed out."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4849> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Multiple Descriptions Scalable Video Coding"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4849> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Multiple description coding (MDC) is a joint source-channel coding technique specifically designed for real-time multimedia applications over best effort switched packet networks (such as Inter-net), in order to cope with packet losses due to transmission errors or network congestion. Error resilience of transmitted bitstreams is thus significantly increased, but this does not solve problems like bitstream adaptation to bandwidth variations or receiver characteristics , which are in turn addressed by scalable coding techniques. In this paper, we present a new method of multiple description coding of scalable video, combining the scalability features with MDC. It is based on a motion-compensated spatio-temporal sub-band decomposition, where the redundancy is tunable in a frame-like non-linear temporal representation."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4850> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4904> <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/Place> "Siena, Italy"

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4904> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/caturi> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/inproceedings>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4904> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Belfiore_Jean-claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4904> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Source-Channel Coding of Scalable Video on a Rayleigh Fading Channel"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4904> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "A joint source-channel coding scheme for scalable video is developed in this paper. An SNR scalable video coder is used and Unequal Error Protection (UEP) is allowed for each scalable layer. Our problem is to allocate the available bit rate across scalable layers and, within each layer, between source and channel coding , while minimizing the end-to-end distortion of the received video sequence. The resulting optimization algorithm we propose utilizes universal rate-distortion characteristic plots. These plots show the contribution of each layer to the total distortion as a function of the source rate of the layer and the residual bit error rate (the error rate that remains after the use of channel coding). Models for these plots are proposed in order to reduce the computational complexity of the solution. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4864> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "An architecture based on semantic weblogs for exploring the Web Of People"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4864> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "This paper presents an architecture that helps users to collect and qualify meta-information about web resources within a weblog and then share them with a group of people. Our architecture is a peer-to-peer network in which each peer contains a personal knowledge base represented in RDF. The designed weblog model is sufficiently robust, and the semantics of our data model is detailed to allow integration in our system of other Semantic Web applications as well as existing weblogs. We construct a \" web of people \" exchange protocol built on two primary services: the first one to query distributed personal knowledge bases, and the second one to enable user awareness based on metadata exchanges in asynchronous mode."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4820> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Estimation of SAR images probability density function parameters can be done either with the help of moment method (\u2720 \u261B \u2721 \u270C \u261E \u2720 \u270E \u270D diagram) or with the help of \" log-statistics \" (logcumulant\u270D-logcumulant\u270F diagram). By analyzing estimator variances, it can be shown that log-statistics are more efficient than classical statistics, allowing a better localisation of these estimations."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/10426> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Adaptation de Contenus Multim\u00E9dia par Transmodage dans MPEG-21"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/10426> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Abstrait : Dans le processus d'adaptation de contenu d'un syst\u00E8me de type Universal Multimedia Access, la possibilit\u00E9 de changer la modalit\u00E9 d'une ressource est un avantage important. Dans cet article nous pr\u00E9sentons un outil de description pour \u00AB transmodage \u00BB (par analogie au transcodage) dans le cadre de la norme MPEG-21. Nous montrons ensuite l'efficacit\u00E9 et la n\u00E9cessit\u00E9 de cet outil par quelques exemples de cas d'utilisation et des applications correspondantes. Notre impl\u00E9mentation de ces applications est bas\u00E9e sur notre approche du logiciel de la r\u00E9f\u00E9rence de MPEG-21 \u00E0 laquelle l'outil de description de transmodage a \u00E9t\u00E9 ajout\u00E9. Nous d\u00E9crivons \u00E9galement l'int\u00E9gration de cette impl\u00E9mentation dans un projet europ\u00E9en IST. Enfin nous concluons en donnant une perspective de la future int\u00E9gration des outils de description de ce type dans MPEG-21."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4897> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/booktitle> "International Conference on Acoustic, Speech and Signal Processing"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4897> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/caturi> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/inproceedings>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4897> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromDpt> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/TSI>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4897> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromGroup> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/TSAC>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4897> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Belfiore_Jean-claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4897> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Cramer-Rao bounds for MIMO channel estimation"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/4897> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper we derive the Cramer-Rao bound (CRB) for the estimation of a multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) channel when a given a priori information about the transmitted sequence is available. This approach also enables to compute the non-data-aided (NDA) bound, i.e. the CRB when the receiver only knows the symbol constellation. We explore various scenarios, including the case of a determin-istic channel and the case of a random channel. Numerical evaluations of the CRB-based bounds are presented for different channels. In particular, the influence of the symbol-constellation size is highlighted. Finally, the performance of an estimator based on the expectation-maximization algorithm is shown to be very close to the proposed bounds."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5396> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5396> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Cramer-Rao bounds for MIMO channel estimation"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5396> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper we derive the Cramer-Rao bound (CRB) for the estimation of a multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) channel when a given a priori information about the transmitted sequence is available. This approach also enables to compute the non-data-aided (NDA) bound, i.e. the CRB when the receiver only knows the symbol constellation. We explore various scenarios, including the case of a determin-istic channel and the case of a random channel. Numerical evaluations of the CRB-based bounds are presented for different channels. In particular, the influence of the symbol-constellation size is highlighted. Finally, the performance of an estimator based on the expectation-maximization algorithm is shown to be very close to the proposed bounds."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6034> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Maximum likelihood approach for blind audio source separation using time-frequency Gaussian source models"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6034> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper we propose a simple time-frequency Gaussian model of audio signals that allows for separation of possibly underdeter-mined and noisy linear instantaneous mixtures. An efficient EM algorithm is proposed to estimate the mixing matrix, the noise co-variance and covariances of the source t-f coefficients over a chosen frame/subband tiling of the time-frequency domain. Results are given on 4 \u00D7 4 and 3 \u00D7 4 noisy mixtures of audio sources."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5621> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Investigation of the channel estimation error on MIMO system performance"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5621> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Multi-Input Multi-Output (MIMO) wireless communication systems provide large capacity allowing high data rates transmission. However, this huge increase of the capacity requires perfect channel knowledge at the receiver. In this paper , we analyze the effect of imperfect channel knowledge on the achievable rates. More precisely, we express a lower bound on the capacity as a function of the channel Cramer-Rao bound (CRB). In previous works, we made the calculation and comparison of CRB for different channel estimation schemes [1] and [2]. This allows us to make comparison of channel achievable rates for different context under various data and pilot design assumptions."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5801> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Wavelet-based Multiple Description Coding of Images with Iterative Convex Optimization Techniques"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5801> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014 We consider the problem of image transmission on error-prone networks with little or no error protection. To this end, we build a multiple description scheme based on classical biorthogonal filter banks, that achieves good reconstruction even at low bitrates. The novelty of the proposed approach mainly consists in building a 2D wavelet frame representation with low redundancy. Another contribution of this work is the use of a convex optimization approach at the decoder end in order to best take advantage of all the received information. The quantization constraints define convex sets, which allow us to apply fast iterative projection techniques to find a feasible solution of the decoding problem."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5802> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5802> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/caturi> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/inproceedings>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5802> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Pesquet_J_-Ch_>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5802> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Perfect Reconstruction in Reduced Redundancy Wavelet-based Multiple Description Coding of Images"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5802> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper, we consider frame expansions derived from biorthogonal wavelet bases for building multiple descriptions with low redundancy constraints. Such constraints rise the problem of perfect reconstruction of the associated decom-positions in the absence of quantization or channel errors, which requires special attention and therefore will be detailed in this work. We will show that several schemes that yield perfect reconstruction are possible with the proposed strategy. Moreover, when the resulting coefficients are corrupted by quantization or channel errors, we employ a fast iterative algorithm based on projections onto convex sets in order to enhance the quality of the decoded images."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5804> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5804> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Codage par descriptions multiples pour la transmission video"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5804> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2013 Dans cet article, nous nous int\u00E9ressonsint\u00E9ressons` a l'utilisation du codage par descriptions multiples pour la transmission de s\u00E9quences vid\u00E9o scalables obtenues avec un codeur ondelettes t + 2D. Ces techniques sont utiles pour des r\u00E9seaux commut\u00E9s, ` a perte de paquets. Contrairement aux approches existantes, la redondance n'est pas introduite dans le domaine spatial mais dans le domaine temporel, gr\u00E2c\u00E8 a des bancs de filtres dyadiques sur-\u00B4 echantillonn\u00E9s, compens\u00E9s en mouvement. Nous fournissons ici un cadre de travail pour construire et\u00E9tudieret\u00B4et\u00E9tudier des sch\u00E9mas de codage par descriptions multiples temporels, bas\u00E9s sur des d\u00E9compositions en ondelettes redondantes avec un facteur de redondance r\u00E9duit, et nous validons cette approche par une application au codage vid\u00E9o. Abstract \u2013 In this paper, we address the problem of multiple description coding for the transmission over best-effort networks of scalable video sequences obtained with a t + 2D wavelet codec. Unlike previous approaches, which consider redundancy insertion in the spatial domain, in this paper we introduce redundancy in the temporal domain of the video sequence, using motion compensated oversampled dyadic filter banks. We are giving here the framework for building such temporal multiple description schemes based on redundant wavelet decompositions with a reduced redundancy feature. The general approach is applied to video coding."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6033> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Statistiques direction-multip\u00F4le pour la s\u00E9paration de composantes dans le fonds de rayonnement cosmologique"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6033> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2013 Cet article d\u00E9crit des statistiques de corr\u00E9lation localis\u00E9es en fr\u00E9quence et position sur la sph\u00E8re et leur application pour la s\u00E9paration de composantes dans les observations multi-spectrales du fonds de rayonnement cosmologique Abstract \u2013 We introduce correlation statistics which are localized both in frequency and position on the sphere and their use for component separation in multi-spectral observations of the comsmological microwave background."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6152> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Estimation des param\u00E8tres de propagation d'un canal MIMO par l'algorithme ESPRIT-Unitaire multidimentionnel"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6152> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2013 Dans ce travail, nous proposons une extension de l'algorithme ESPRIT-Unitaire au cas multidimensionnel (6D) afin d'estimer les diff\u00E9rents param\u00E8tres du canal radio r\u00E9gi par un mod\u00E8le de propagation en rayons. Cette m\u00E9thode nous permet d'estimer pour un syst\u00E8me MIMO (Multi-Input Multi-Output) tous les param\u00E8tres utiles des rayons, i.e. les angles d'\u00E9mission et de r\u00E9ception (azimuth et \u00E9l\u00E9vation), les retards, les dopplers et les amplitudes complexes. On \u00E9tablit aussi la robustesse de cette m\u00E9thode vis \u00E0 vis d'une surestimation du nombre de trajets 'effectifs' du canal. Cette robustesse nous permet, en particulier, de nous affranchir de l'\u00E9tape 'd\u00E9licate' de l'estimation du nombre de trajets. Nous pr\u00E9sentons quelques r\u00E9sultats de simulation permettant d'\u00E9valuer l'efficacit\u00E9 de cette nouvelle m\u00E9thode et d'illustrer sa robustesse vis \u00E0 vis de la m\u00E9connaissance du nombre de trajets. Abstract \u2013 In this work, we propose an extension of the ESPRIT-Unitaire algorithm in the multidimensional case (6D) in order to estimate the various parameters of the radio channel governed by a propagation ray model. This method enables us to estimate for a MIMO system (Multi-Input Multi-Output) all the useful parameters of the rays, i.e. the angles of emission and reception (azimuth and elevation), the delays, the dopplers and the complex amplitudes. In addition we establish the robustness of this method with respect to an over-estimation of the number of 'effectives' rays of the channel. This robustness enables us, in particular, to avoid the 'delicate' stage of the estimation of the number of rays. We present at the end some simulation results to evaluate the effectiveness and robustness of this new method."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6214> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Belfiore_Jean-claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6214> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Optimal space-time codes for the MIMO Amplify-and-Forward cooperative channel"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6214> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this work, we extend the non-orthogonal amplify-and-forward (NAF) cooperative diversity scheme to the MIMO channel. A family of space-time block codes for a half-duplex MIMO NAF fading cooperative channel with N relays is constructed. The code construction is based on the non-vanishing determinant (NVD) criterion and is shown to achieve the optimal diversity-multiplexing tradeoff (DMT) of the channel. We provide a general explicit algebraic construction, followed by some examples. In particular, in the single-relay case, it is proved that the Golden code and the 4\u00D74 Perfect code are optimal for the single-antenna and two-antenna case, respectively. Simulation results reveal that a significant gain (up to 10 dB) can be obtained with the proposed codes, especially in the single-antenna case. Index Terms Cooperative diversity, relay channel, amplify-and-forward (AF), multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO), space-time block code, non-vanishing determinant (NVD), diversity-multiplexing tradeoff (DMT). NOTATIONS In this paper, we use boldface lower case letters v v v to denote vectors, boldface capital letters M M M to denote matrices. CN represents the complex Gaussian random variable. <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6216> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "The impact of channel estimation error on the DPC region of the two-user Gaussian broadcast channel"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6216> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this work, we study the impact of channel estimation error at the transmitter end on the achievable rate region of a two-user single-antenna Gaussian Broadcast Channel with dirty paper coding (DPC). In terms of channel estimation error, we establish the condition under which the dirty paper coding is better than the time sharing. We show that the performance of a naive implementation of dirty paper coding on the known part of the interference is very sensitive to channel estimation noise and therefore not suitable for practical use. <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5845> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Combining Optical and SAR data to monitor temperate glaciers"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5845> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Monitoring temperate glaciers activity becomes more and more necessary for economical and security reasons and as an indicator of the local effects of global changes. This paper presents the beginning of a three year project which regroups four laboratories to develop and combine specific methods to extract information from optical and radar remote sensing data. Preliminary results are presented on three different information sources: airborne photography, space-borne multi-spectral images and SAR interferome-try, which respectively allow the compution of high resolution DTM, the detection of glacial lakes and the measurement of glacier surface velocity. Results obtained on two glaciers located in the French Alps are compared and validated with ground measurments."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9635> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Context-Aware Semantic Adaptation of Multimedia Presentations"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9635> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper, we present our work on context-aware semantic adaptation of multimedia structured documents. We introduce the semantic annotation of a multimedia scene, providing semantic information on each media object of the scene, as well as on the dependencies between all the media objects. The proposed description tools are based on the framework of MPEG-21. We use these semantic annotations in order to perform a semantic adaptation on multimedia presentations. We aim to show that, in order to preserve the consistency and meaningfulness of the adapted multimedia scene, the adaptation process needs to have access to the semantic information of the presentation."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9636> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9636> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/caturi> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/article>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9636> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromDpt> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/TSI>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9636> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromGroup> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/MM>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9636> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Dufourd_Jean-Claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9636> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Support de transmodage de contenus multim\u00E9dia dans MPEG-21. Etude et validation d'un outil de description"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9636> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Dans le processus d'adaptation de contenu d'un syst\u00E8me de type Universal Multimedia Access, la possibilit\u00E9 de changer la modalit\u00E9 d'une ressource est un avantage important. Dans cet article nous pr\u00E9sentons un outil de description de \u00AB transmodage \u00BB \u00E0 la vol\u00E9e, dans le cadre de la norme MPEG-21. Nous montrons ensuite l'efficacit\u00E9 et la n\u00E9cessit\u00E9 de cet outil de description par quelques exemples de cas d'utilisation et les applications correspondantes. Notre impl\u00E9mentation de ces applications est bas\u00E9e sur notre version du logiciel de r\u00E9f\u00E9rence de MPEG-21 \u00E0 laquelle l'outil de description de transmodage a \u00E9t\u00E9 ajout\u00E9. Nous d\u00E9crivons \u00E9galement l'int\u00E9gration de cette impl\u00E9mentation dans un projet europ\u00E9en IST. Enfin nous concluons en donnant une perspective de la future int\u00E9gration des outils de description de ce type dans MPEG-21. ABSTRACT. Transmoding is an important part in the content adaptation process of a Universal Multimedia Access system. In this paper we introduce a description tool for online transmoding in MPEG-21. We then give some use case scenarios for adaptation by transmoding. We also demonstrate the efficiency and the necessity of the transmoding description tool through some use cases and the corresponding applications. Our implementation of these applications is based on our approach of the MPEG-21 reference software to which the transmoding description tool has been added. Also we describe the integration of this implementation into an IST European project. Finally we end up by giving a perspective for future integration of transmoding-type description tools in MPEG-21. MOTS-CL\u00C9S : ressource multim\u00E9dia, modalit\u00E9, transmodage, conversion de modalit\u00E9, Universal Multimedia Access."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/10425> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Resource Conversion in MPEG-21 DIA"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/10425> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "MPEG-21 standard aims at defining elements needed to support a multimedia delivery chain. This paper introduces our approach for a media resource conversion framework in MPEG-21 DIA. We propose description tools for describing conversion parameters and preferences. We show that the metadata given in these descriptors, which are provided by either the author of the content or any other involving entity in the adaptation chain, helps the adaptation engine decide on the optimal nature, type and parameters of the adaptation that is to be applied to the media resource."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/7406> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper we present a new construction of Algebraic Space-Time Block Codes with a temporal code length larger than the number of transmit antennas. We call these codes \" Rectangular Space-Time Block Codes \"-RSTBC. The construction of the RSTBCs is entirely inspired by and based on the construction of Perfect codes [1] which are the best square STBCs known in the litterature."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5246> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Duan_G_%2520H_>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5246> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Phase Correlation between Longitudinal Modes in Semiconductor Self-Pulsating DBR Lasers"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5246> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014Phase correlation leading to self-pulsation (SP) in semiconductor distributed Bragg reflector (DBR) lasers is investigated experimentally and theoretically. Under proper biasing conditions, the laser oscillates with three main modes and we observe that each two-modes beating provides SP with identical spectral linewidth. Under the same operating conditions, the measured spectral linewidths of the beating modes are much larger than the linewidth of the self-pulsating signal. These results demonstrate the natural occurrence of passive mode-locking (PML) and phase correlation in semiconductor DBR lasers. A model based on multimode coupled-wave rate equations, including four-wave mixing (FWM), is developed to describe PML and SP in the gain region of the laser cavity. This model demonstrates that the existence of phase correlation between longitudinal modes is due to FWM. Index Terms\u2014Distributed Bragg reflector (DBR) lasers, four-wave mixing (FWM), mode-locked lasers, phase synchronization, self-pulsating lasers."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/booktitle> "International Workshop on PHysics and Applications of SEmiconductor LASERs,"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/caturi> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/inproceedings>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromDpt> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/COMELEC>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/fromGroup> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/GTO>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Provost_J_-G_>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Duan_G_%2520H_>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Polarization Insensitive 40 GHz Self-Pulsating DBR Lasers with Wide Self-Pulsation Frequency Tunability"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5259> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In order to improve transmission distance, transparency, capacity and speed of optical networks, much attention has been paid to investigate practical means for all-optical signal processing [1,2]. All-optical clock recovery regeneration at 40 Gbit/s and beyond appears to be a crucial element for future transparent networks. Among the different approaches investigated so far, we can mention a scheme of particular interest based on a single self-pulsating (SP) distributed Bragg reflector (DBR) laser [3]. In this paper, we report a polarization insensitive DBR laser with high confinement factor. Non linear operation that generates SP has been achieved at low injection current level. We also report that the separation of the gain region into two sections in such a laser allows increasing the tuning range of the SP frequency up to 1 GHz, the largest value achieved on this kind of SP lasers. The studied DBR laser has 3 sections: an active, a phase and a Bragg section [3]. Figure 1 shows the power level coupled to a single mode fibre and the SP frequency as a function of the injection current into the active section. For injection current varying from 50 mA to 200 mA, 3 mode jumps occur due to the thermal effects. It is remarkable that SP begins at 50 mA, an injection current level less than 2 times of the threshold (36 mA), demonstrating that the non linear effects are largely enhanced due to the high confinement factor (~ 0.70) in such a structure. Fig. 1: Output power and SP frequency versus the active current, for studied DBR laser structure. Fig. 2: Wavelength of dominant mode and SP frequency versus the active current, for a bulk DBR laser with double active section. Another configuration of the studied DBR lasers is the one with double active sections. In this configuration, the active region is separated into two sections: one shorter of 50 \u00B5m, and one longer of 810 \u00B5m. These two sections are electrically isolated. Figure 2 shows the variation of the wavelength of the main mode and the SP frequency as a function of the active current into the longer section, while the shorter section is biased at 5 mA. One can see that the SP frequency varies continuously in the current range between 60 and 150 mA, while there are 3 jumps of the dominant mode. The tuning range of SP frequency is larger than 1 GHz. Such a behaviour, reproducible over an array of 5 lasers, may result from the modified spatial photon density distribution due to the separated electrodes of the active region. In conclusion, 40 GHz self-pulsating distributed Bragg reflector lasers with a polarization insensitive bulk active layer of 0.7x0.5 \u00B5m 2 showed enhanced non-linear behavior compared to multi-quantum wells lasers. Nearly 1 GHz of continuous self-pulsation frequency tunability using two active sections has been achieved. Such a laser will be used in system experiment for all-optical clock recovery at 40 GHz. References: [1] A. Jourdan, \" The perspective of optical packet switching in IP dominant backbone and metropolitan networks \" , IEEE Communication"

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5430> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Comparison Of Redundant Wavelet Schemes For Multiple Description Coding Of Video Sequences"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5430> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Multiple description coding (MDC) recently appeared as a joint source-channel coding technique specifically designed for real-time multimedia applications over best effort switched packet networks such as Internet, in order to cope with packet losses due to transmission errors or network congestion. In this paper we compare several redundant wavelet decompositions in the framework of multiple description of scalable video coding. A special attention is paid to the optimal design of the central decoder. Simulation results are provided for motion-compensated filter banks so as to evaluate the efficiency of the central and side decoding strategies. Compared with other techniques, a key factor of the proposed analysed schemes is their reduced redundancy factor."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5922> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Mobile Computing to Facilitate Interaction in Lectures and Meetings"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5922> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "The Campus Mobile project explored how PDAs and innovative interfaces can improve interaction during lectures and in small meetings. These mobile computers (small PCs or PDAs) are nomad mediators that provide the link between the public space and the user's private space. A lecturer uses an augmented whiteboard to annotate her presentation, while the slides and annotations are broadcast in real time to the stu-dents' PDAs. The students can also annotate the presentation. They can then replay the lecture at their leisure. We developed and tested the user interfaces for the interactions on the white-board and on the PDAs, the data formats to store the annotations and temporal data, and the network protocol for reliable wireless broadcast transmission. Small meetings have a very different interaction pattern. Instead of a lecturer that transmits knowledge, the participants collaborate in modifying documents. We developed groupware services that encourage these interactions and show how the different interaction patterns imply different network usages."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5421> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Starck_J_-L_>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5421> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Independent component separation from incomplete spherical data using wavelets. application to CMB data analysis."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/5421> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Spectral matching ICA (SMICA) is a source separation method based on covariance matching in Fourier space that was designed to address in a flexible way some of the general problems raised by Cosmic Microwave Background data analysis. However, a common issue in astronomical data analysis is that the observations are unevenly sampled or incomplete maps with missing patches or intentionally masked parts. In addition, many astrophysical emissions are not well mod-eled as stationary processes over the sky. These effects impair data processing techniques in the spherical harmonics representation. This paper describes a new wavelet transform for spherical maps and proposes an extension of SMICA in this space-scale representation."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/7449> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Distributed Algebraic Space Time Codes for Ultra Wideband Communications"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/7449> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper, we extend the Amplify-and-Forward cooperative diversity scheme to the context of impulse radio ultra-wideband. In particular, we present the construction of two families of distributed algebraic space-time codes. The first family is based on totally real cyclic division algebras. The second family encodes the pulses used to transmit one information symbol and permits to achieve high-performance levels with lower complexity. Both families of codes achieve full rate, full diversity with non-vanishing determinants with various numbers of relays. Simulations performed over realistic indoor UWB channel models show important performance gains."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6314> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Using GPU for fast block-matching"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6314> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "On the one hand, basic PCs include by default more and more powerful GPU (Graphics Processing Unit) that sometimes even outperforms CPU (Central Processing Unit) for some specific tasks. On the other hand, video processing are more and more useful and required for numerous emerging services and applications but is often too computational expensive to reach real time. Within the context of GPGPU (General Purpose GPU), we propose in this paper a possible implementation of a block-matching algorithm. Some significant results are obtained in terms of acceleration and quality. Based on our experiments on Block-Matching within the context of video compression, we finally underline some existing limitations of using GPUs beyond graphics for image and video processing even if this concept remains attractive."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6983> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Integrating a QPSK Quantum Key Distribution Link"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6983> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "We present the integration of the optical and electronic subsystems of a BB84-QKD fiber link. A high speed FPGA MODEM generates the random QPSK sequences for a fiber-optic delayed self-homodyne scheme using APD detectors. Introduction In fiber-optic quantum key distribution (QKD) at telecommunications wavelengths, QPSK encoding of Alice's Qbits constitutes an attractive modulation format [1, 2] since it could be detected in differential interferometric schemes that need only one fiber, thus relaxing the requirements in phase and polarization stability and providing a more reliable long distance QKD link, and at the same time simplifies the system's integration and control."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/7409> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "On the Golden code performance for MIMO-HSDPA systems"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/7409> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014 In this paper, we propose a new MIMO-HSDPA transmission scheme with two transmit and two receive antennas, using an optimal Space-Time block code: the Golden code [1]. This code has a full rate, a full diversity, achieves the Diversity-Multiplexing gain tradeoff and preserves the mutual information. The proposed scheme is compared to the RCMPD [2] a scheme which has also a full rate and a full diversity. The major disadvantage of the later is the generation of the Multiple Access Interference (MAI) even on a flat fading channel. Simulation results show that the proposed scheme has better performances specially for high spectral efficiency. The RCMPD performance are hardly affected by the MAI."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9317> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "MIMO UWB Communications Using Modified Hermite Pulses"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9317> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper, we present a new full rate scheme for exploiting diversity in multi-antenna ultra-wideband (UWB) systems. The independent data streams that are transmitted simultaneously from the different antennas are rendered orthogonal by the use of modified Hermite pulses. At a second time, appropriate real rotations enhance the transmit diversity level. We also consider, for the first time, the problem of Maximum Likelihood (ML) detection with multi-dimensional PPM and hybrid PPM-PAM constellations that can be used in conjunction with the proposed scheme."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9318> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9318> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/creator> <http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/persons/Belfiore_Jean-claude>
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9318> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Distributed Space-Time Coding with Ultra-Wideband Systems"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9318> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "In this paper, we extend the Amplify-and-Forward (AF) cooperative diversity scheme to the context of impulse radio ul-tra wideband (IR-UWB). In particular, we apply a space-time (ST) coding scheme based on totally-real cyclic division algebras in order to achieve full diversity with no data rate losses. At a second time, the pulse repetitions are exploited in order to enhance the performance of the first scheme and to propose a new scheme that achieves comparable performance with lower complexity. These schemes are associated with pulse position modulation (PPM), pulse amplitude modulation (PAM) and hybrid pulse position and amplitude modulation (PPM-PAM)."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6561> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "A Secure and Efficient Link State Routing Protocol for Ad Hoc Networks"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6561> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Routing protocols in ad hoc networks are vulnerable to various attacks. Many solutions have been proposed to secure ad hoc routing protocols in recent research but often at the price of significant traffic and processing overhead, which may be undesirable for ad hoc networks with limited bandwidth and processing power. In this paper, we present and evaluate a secure and efficient link state routing protocol for ad hoc networks (SELRAN). We propose Secure Link State Update Procedure (SLSUP) and Secure Neighbor Establishment Procedure (SNEP) in SELRAN to counter external and internal uncoordinated attacks. We also use counter-based mechanism to reduce the broadcast overhead of the LSU packets in SELRAN, which makes SELRAN efficient in resource-constraint environments such as ad hoc networks. Analysis and simulation results show that SELRAN effectively thwarts a wide range of attacks to ad hoc routing, and is able to maintain high packet delivery ratio even in hostile environments."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9319> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "A Space-Time Block Coded Multiuser MIMO Downlink Transmission Scheme"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/9319> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014 In this paper, we consider the downlink of a space time block coded multiuser multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) system. We propose a transmission scheme to support highest possible data rate and full diversity for multiuser MIMO systems. For this, threaded algebraic space-time block codes and perfect space-time block codes are employed. Different spreading matrices are used to separate the data streams of multiple users. After despreading the signal sequence at the receiver of each user, the maximum likelihood decoding is obtained by a lattice decoder. Performance of the multiuser MIMO system in the presence of multiple access interference is evaluated by simulations in terms of block error rate."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6566> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "A Lightweight Mechanism to Secure OLSR"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6566> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Routing protocols in ad hoc networks are vulnerable to various attacks. Many solutions have been proposed to secure ad hoc routing protocols in recent research but at the price of significant traffic and processing overhead, which may be undesirable for the ad hoc networks with limited bandwidth and processing power. In this paper, we present and evaluate a lightweight mechanism to secure OLSR (Optimized Link State Routing [1]). In our approach, the mechanism of coherence check is applied to secure the link state update. To secure the neighbor establishment, we adopt the idea based on proof introduced in AD-VSIG [2]. We identify a security flaw in ADVSIG and then propose a solution to counter it. Besides, we use the hash chain technique to reduce the processing overhead of HELLO messages in the neighbor establishment. Simulation results show that our approach is both lightweight and robust without degrading significantly the performance of OLSR."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/7019> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/7369> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "New Peer-To-Peer System Approach for Service Deployment"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/7369> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "Active networks have been researched for years and many studies have been done in the active node architecture, the active networks protocols and the needed functionalities. However, some of these functionalities do not achieve satisfactory results. The deployment of services in active nodes still remains a challenge, and consequently inhibits the widespread use of such networks. In this paper, a new concept based on a Peer-to-Peer system to enhance the service deployment in active networks is presented. This P2P system is used by active nodes to advertise theirs capabilities, which enables \"control active nodes\" to perform the service deployment, depending on the service requirements and constraints. The concept of administrative domains is also taken into account for widespread active networks. The originality of this work lies on the complete integration of the active networks and P2P systems with the goal of rendering service operators the capacity to deploy new services according to each request and the availability of the resources."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6507> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "A 2x2 Antennas Ultra-Wideband System with Biorthogonal Pulse Position Modulation"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6507> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014 The Golden code [1] is a 2 \u00D7 2 space-time code that achieves the best known performance with all constellations carved from Z[i]. In this letter, we present the construction of a new coding scheme for 2M-ary biorthogonal pulse position modulations (BPPM) with M \u2265 4. The proposed code satisfies all of the construction constraints of the Golden code and it has the additional advantage of being totally real making it suitable for low cost carrier-less ultra-wideband terminals. Namely, this totally real construction achieves full rate and full diversity with the best known coding gain and without any shaping losses for 2M-BPPM with M \u2265 4."

<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6349> <http://purl.org/dc/terms/title> "Joint source-channel coding with partially coded index assignment for robust scalable video"
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6349> <http://purl.org/spar/doco/Abstract> "\u2014A scalable video coder consisting of motion-compensated temporal filtering coupled with structured vector quantization plus a linear mapping of quantizer indexes that minimizes simultaneously source and channel distortions is presented. The linear index assignment takes the form of either a direct, uncoded mapping or a coded mapping via Reed\u2013Muller codes. Experimental results compare the proposed system to a similar scheme using unstructured vector quantization as well as to a prominent scalable video coder protected by more traditional convolutional codes. The proposed system consistently outper-forms the other two schemes by a significant margin for very noisy channel conditions. Index Terms\u2014Joint source-channel coding (JSCC), scalable video coding."
<http://givingsense.eu/sembib/onto/tpt/biblio/6418> <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/ResearchPaper>
